newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Komercni cuts reference rate to 19.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: Czech Komercni cuts reference rate to 19.6 pct.

text.p: The largest Czech commercial bank, Komercin Banka a.s. said on Wednesday that it would cut its key reference rate on credit to 19.6 percent from 24.6 percent effective on Thursday.
The reference rate is the bank's peg, which shadows an average of the six-month Prague interbank offered rate (PRIBOR), for setting its entire schedule of interest rates.
The six-month PRIBOR on Wednesday was 22.05 percent down from 23.91 percent on Tuesday.
Komercni said its base rate would be lowered by 440 basis points to 17.3 percent.

The bank had hiked its rates substantially in late May reflecting a sharp increase on the interbank market as the Czech National Bank tightened liquidity to combat short-selling of the Czech crown which was under heavy downward pressure.
